title: Hurting People’s Feelings
post:
I suspect the root of all this is the lamentable imprecision in modern English usage.  Personally, I blame that rat b****rd Roget.  When the artless, clay-brained knaves* who call themselves journalists these days encounter domains of knowledge where linguistic precision is prized, necessary, and cultivated, the results are…well, you’ve provided a good sampling.  I will note, though, that theology and science seem equally affected.  Coverage of science stories in the popular media is just as bad.  
And they say faith and reason have nothing in common.
* Description of journalists courtesy of the Shakespearean Insult Kit: http://www.pangloss.com/seidel/shake_rule.html
author: Jeff
